Blog.post: Hair is a funny thing. Or should I say, my hair is funny. See, I shaved my head a few weeks ago (long story) and now I'm growing it back. At least, I'm trying to grow it back. See, I have Chinese genes, and standard Chinese hair. That means my hair is thin, straight and the roots are spread out. That means when my hair is short, I can't do anything with it. In fact, I'm at the complete submission of whatever my hair wants to do. Unfortunately, it only ever wants to do one thing when it's short: stick straight up. So I'm dealing with what my hair is: a Chinese Afro. A Chafro? A Chifro? It sticks straight out on the sides and back, and straight up on top. Hair glue products are futile since my hair is so thin - I can get a few to stick together, but that just makes my hair look like a spikey Chafro. Spikey is too generous; it looks more like a black Chiapet. So until I hit that magical 1.5 inches up top, I will suffer in silence with my Chafro.
"This is the tenth converstaion we've had about Chris's testicles today! One or two a day is normal, but this is too many." -Terence

Subtle Devices is a place for me to write - simple as that. I'll cover anything that interests me - Short essays or observations on everything I come across. I used to write for a living and I miss it. Now, I only write dry half-english, third-person, wishy-washy, template-driven lab reports. No creativity or humor allowed (lawyers have no appreciation for sarcasm). Subtle Devices is for me, because when I write I am infinitely amusing to myself. This site isn't completely about me, nor is it a list of what I had for lunch, what I did at the gym, or that I am going to sleep now. No one cares about what brand of socks I wear and if you do, you need to get out more. I will try to be funny when I can. Reading humor is great, but it is difficult and time consuming to write. I will delve into serious subjects, but I don't take anything I write seriously. I will not have a rambling stream of conciousness...filled...with...elipsees... I will use proper HTML. I will never say "Click Here". I willl use proper grammar (knowledge permitting). I will use as few inside jokes as possible (unless it's an inside joke with myself). I will use a lot of parentheticals (bad habit, but I think this way). So as soon as the DNS propagates, I will write!

I did a good thing. I registered for the urlLink National Bone Marrow Donor Program . If there's a sick person out there that can use my bone marrow, they'll contact me. It's a great program. Think of it this way - a few days of discomfort for you to save someone's life. Just think about that for a second. Why would you not want to do it?
